cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW today, cross or skirt northern Yucatan late Monday, then accelerate NW across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast – most likely southeast Louisiana to Mississippi/Alabama coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, including Cozumel, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for Pinar del Río Province, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind probabilities peak at 24% with a small (6%) chance of 50-kt winds late Wednesday; gusty gale-force winds possible at the port Wednesday afternoon-night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early surge guidance not issued yet, but a 2–4 ft surge is plausible for Mobile Bay if Zeta approaches just west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with localized higher totals, producing flash flooding in the Mobile area Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and short-fuse flooding of low wharves possible during peak onshore flow.
